page.title: 13PLAYING FIELDS
page.content: THE PLAYING FIELD IN PIG LANE WAS FIRST LEASED FROM OXFORD UNIVERSITY, THE LANDOWNERS,IN 1981.THE RENT IS Â£75 P.A.THE FIELD IS RUN BY A COMMITTEE OF REPRESENTATIVES FROM VILLAGE ORGANISATIONS.THEY RECEIVED AN INITIAL GRANT FROM SEDGEMOOR DISTRICT COUNCIL OF Â£1,500 TO HELP SET OUT THE FIELD FOR SPORTS AND TO FENCE IT.THERE IS A SANDPIT FOR LONG-JUMP,A RUNNING TRACK,CRICKET AND ROUNDERS PITCHES AND A FOOTBALL PITCH IN WINTER.THE SCHOOL- CHILDREN PLAY MATCHES AGAINST OTHER SCHOOLS AND JOIN WITH MIDDLEZOY SCHOOL FOR CRICKET COACHING.EVERY YEAR FUND- RAISING EVENTS ARE HELD BY THE COMMITTEE.THESE ARE A FLOWER AND DOG SHOW IN JULY,WHICH ATTRACTS COMPETITORS FROM THE SURROUNDING VILLAGES,A SKITTLE WEEK,WHEN MONEY PRIZES ARE GIVEN TO THE HIGHEST SCORER AND A HARVEST SUPPER AND DRAW.
